name: Who am I?
description: In this game, players take on secret identities and provide clever clues to unravel each other's personas. Uncover the mystery behind the question 'Who Am I?' as you engage in a fun-filled adventure of wit and strategy.

name: Future of Artificial Intelligence: Discuss the impact and potential consequences of advancing artificial intelligence.
description: Every person in the circle ask the next person question related to one of the topics.

name: Kahoot!
description: Play engaging quiz-based games.

name: The Impact of Technology on Daily Life
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Discuss how technology has changed the way businesses operate and the impact on job roles.
listitem2: 2. Explore the disparities in access to technology and how it affects different communities.
listitem3: 3. Talk about how technology influences personal relationships, including friendships and romantic partnerships.
listitem4: 4. Discuss concerns about excessive screen time and strategies for managing digital addiction.
listitem5: 5. Explore the importance of online security and protecting personal information in the digital age.

name: Daily Routine 1/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How many hours do you usually sleep?
listitem2: 2. Are you good at sport?
listitem3: 3. How much time do you spend doing exercise? Where do you go?
listitem4: 4. When did you last learn something new? Where were you?
listitem5: 5. How often do you play sport?

name: Daily Routine 2/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you usually get up before 7a.m.?
listitem2: 2. How often do you phone your parents?
listitem3: 3. How many texts or messages do you send in a week?
listitem4: 4. Do you think it`s a good idea to write to-do lists?
listitem5: 5. Why do you think men who do housework feel happier than those who don`t?

name: Daily Routine 3/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Can you describe your daily commute?
listitem2: 2. How do you prioritize tasks and responsibilities in your daily life?
listitem3: 3. Are there any specific tools or apps you use for time management?
listitem4: 4. Can you share any advice on staying organized throughout the day?
listitem5: 5. How do you handle time-sensitive tasks and deadlines?

name: Daily Routine 4/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How do you unwind and de-stress in the evening?
listitem2: 2. Are there any activities or rituals that help you relax before sleep?
listitem3: 3. How does your daily routine differ on weekends compared to weekdays?
listitem4: 4. What are some of your favorite weekend activities or hobbies?
listitem5: 5. Do you have any weekend traditions or rituals?

name: Hobbies and interests 1/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What do you do that really interests you?
listitem2: 2. How often do you read a newspaper?
listitem3: 3. What small things in life do you enjoy?
listitem4: 4. Think about three things that make you happy (e.g. my family, walking on the beach, eating good food).
listitem5: 5. Do you ever go camping?

name: Hobbies and interests 2/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How often do you read newspapers, magazines, or online news sources?
listitem2: 2. What types of media do you consume regularly, such as books, podcasts, or TV shows?
listitem3: 3. Are there any specific topics or genres you enjoy reading or learning about?
listitem4: 4. What are some common leisure activities people in your country engage in during their free time?
listitem5: 5. What benefits do you believe people gain from pursuing their hobbies during their leisure time?

name: Hobbies and interests 3/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you have any memorable experiences with outdoor activities like camping, hiking, or picnicking?
listitem2: 2. How often do you participate in outdoor adventures, and what motivates you to do so?
listitem3: 3. What natural landscapes or destinations have you explored through outdoor activities?
listitem4: 4. Describe a recent interest or hobby that you've discovered.
listitem5: 5. How do people spend their free time in your country?

name: Hobbies and interests 4/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Where can you go/what things can you do for free, or very cheaply, where you live?
listitem2: 2. Which sports are popular in your country? Which have you tried?
listitem3: 3. How do you keep up-to-date with the news?
listitem4: 4. What have been the most important stories in the last five years?
listitem5: 5. Do you know any conspiracy theories? What happened?

name: Personal Growth 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Would you like to change anything in your life? What would you change? Why?
listitem2: 2. Why do you think many people do not manage to live their dreams?
listitem3: 3. What were your childhood ambitions? What do you do now?
listitem4: 4. What do you hope to become in the future?
listitem5: 5. What advice would you give to someone who wants to be successful?

name: Personal Growth 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What things have you been successful at? What factors do you think contributed to that success?
listitem2: 2. Are there any particular skills you wish you had? Do you think you could be successful at that skill if you worked hard at it?
listitem3: 3. Would you enjoy the life of a professional sportsperson? Why?/Why not?
listitem4: 4. What ambitions do you hope to achieve in your own life?
listitem5: 5. What achievements are you proud of?

name: Work 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Which jobs are dangerous? Why? How often are the people in dangerous situations?
listitem2: 2. How do you get to work?
listitem3: 3. Where would you choose to live and how would you get to work?
listitem4: 4. Do you think people work too much? What problems can this cause?
listitem5: 5. Would you like to take over your father or your mother's job?

name: Work 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What boring tasks take up your time?
listitem2: 2. Have you ever turned down a good offer?
listitem3: 3. Which jobs do you think are dangerous/enjoyable/boring? Why?
listitem4: 4. In your job or studies, is there anything you are not happy with?
listitem5: 5. When you imagine the perfect career, what do you think of?

name: Traveling 1/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you ever travel by aeroplane? How frequently?
listitem2: 2. When you visit a new city, what kind of things do you like to do?
listitem3: 3. Do you like to see and do the things a tourist would do, or do you prefer to spend time with the local people? Why?
listitem4: 4. How many types of transport can you think of in two minutes? Make a list.
listitem5: 5. What do you think is the best way to travel? Why?

name: Traveling 2/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you travel light?
listitem2: 2. What do you usually pack when you go away for a short trip/long holiday?
listitem3: 3. Have you ever been on a long and/or difficult journey? What can you remember about it.
listitem4: 4. Where do tourists like to go when they visit your country? What problems do they have?
listitem5: 5. Do you enjoy visiting tourist areas, old cities, new cities, or none of these?

name: Traveling 3/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you like wild places?
listitem2: 2. Have you ever slept outdoors or been out in the wild?
listitem3: 3. Which wild places would you like to visit?
listitem4: 4. Which types of transport do you use regularly?
listitem5: 5. Which do you think are the most enjoyable ways to travel?

name: Traveling 4/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you ever travel by plane? Do you enjoy it?
listitem2: 2. What do you like/dislike about air travel?
listitem3: 3. Have you ever been on a long and/or difficult journey? What can you remember about it?
listitem4: 4. When you travel, do you try to learn about the place, its customs and its language? Why/Why not?
listitem5: 5. Do you enjoy visiting tourist areas, old cities, new cities, or none of these?

name: Food and Cooking 1/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What is your favourite food?
listitem2: 2. Do you eat a lot of meat?
listitem3: 3. Do you ever eat food from other countries/ cultures? If so, what?
listitem4: 4. Which of these foods do you a) never eat b) eat a lot of?
listitem5: 5. Which types of food/drink do you think are a) very good b) very bad for your health?

name: Food and Cooking 2/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What's the best street food you've ever eaten?
listitem2: 2. Is there anything you would never eat?
listitem3: 3. Do you know any cities which are good for food? What types of food are they best known for?
listitem4: 4. Which areas have good restaurants?
listitem5: 5. What traditional food do you cook/eat at home?

name: Food and Cooking 3/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Are there specific neighborhoods or areas within these cities known for having excellent restaurants?
listitem2: 2. Have you personally visited any of these culinary cities, and what was your dining experience like?
listitem3: 3. How do you think the food culture of a city contributes to its overall identity and tourism?
listitem4: 4. What are your favorite international cuisines, and which dishes from around the world do you enjoy the most?
listitem5: 5. Have you had the opportunity to taste authentic international cuisine in its home country or region?

name: Food and Cooking 4/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Discuss the joy you find in experimenting with ingredients and creating your own culinary dishes.
listitem2: 2. Can you describe a recent instance where you improvised and invented a new recipe?
listitem3: 3. Talk about memorable restaurant experiences you've had and the aspects that made them special.
listitem4: 4. Do you have any favorite restaurants or eateries that you frequently visit? What makes them stand out?
listitem5: 5. Share stories of unique or exotic foods you've tried while dining out.

name: Communication skills
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What topics do you usually talk about?
listitem2: 2. What do you say when somebody interrupts you?
listitem3: 3. Do you ever gossip about celebrities?
listitem4: 4. Are you good at telling jokes?
listitem5: 5. Can you think of any bad conversation habits?

name: Health and Fitness Trends 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you think men or women go to the doctor more often? Why do you think this is?
listitem2: 2. What reasons do you think people give for not going to see a doctor?
listitem3: 3. Do you enjoy sports? Which ones?
listitem4: 4. Have you ever tried to learn a new sport? How successful were you? Why?
listitem5: 5. Have you ever won a sporting competition or attempted a sporting challenge? How did you feel?

name: Health and Fitness Trends 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. If you were the health minister, how would you improve your nation's health?
listitem2: 2. How do activities like meditation, yoga, or deep breathing exercises contribute to your mental well-being?
listitem3: 3. Can you recommend any favorite plant-based recipes or food alternatives?
listitem4: 4. Do you engage in team sports or prefer individual activities? Why?
listitem5: 5. Can you share any tips or techniques for maintaining mental fitness in a busy lifestyle?

name: Money 1/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you usually pay by cash or credit card when you buy things?
listitem2: 2. Do you ever lend money to family or friends? Why/Why not?
listitem3: 3. Have you ever borrowed a lot of money? What for?
listitem4: 4. How many notes or coins do you have in your pocket at the moment?
listitem5: 5. In your country, how much do you tip waiters?

name: Money 2/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Which three people do you think earn the most money in your country?
listitem2: 2. Have you ever invested money in something?
listitem3: 3. Who pays the bills where you live?
listitem4: 4. Which of your possessions is worth the most to you?
listitem5: 5. Have you ever thought of hunting for treasure?

name: Money 3/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you know any true stories or films that involved hunting for treasure?
listitem2: 2. Why do you think spending money on others makes people happier?
listitem3: 3. Do you think it is right that some people earn huge salaries?
listitem4: 4. Do you think financial incentives work?
listitem5: 5. Do you agree that people in a society are happier if the gap between rich and poor is smaller?

name: Love and relationship 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you believe in love at first sight? Why/Why not?
listitem2: 2. Where are good places to meet new people?
listitem3: 3. How do you think people usually feel the week before their wedding?
listitem4: 4. What kind of things can go wrong when you are preparing for a wedding?
listitem5: 5. How popular are online dating websites in your country?

name: Love and relationship 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you think people who use them are always honest about themselves on online dating websites?
listitem2: 2. Have you ever experienced a moment where you felt a strong connection with someone upon first meeting them?
listitem3: 3. What qualities or characteristics do you consider most important in a romantic partner?
listitem4: 4. How do you approach the topic of love and relationships in your life?
listitem5: 5. Can you share any valuable lessons or insights you've gained from past relationships?

name: Personality 1/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you have hidden talents?
listitem2: 2. Why do people tell lies about their lives?
listitem3: 3. When might you tell a lie?
listitem4: 4. What three words best describe you?
listitem5: 5. What is your idea of perfect happiness?

name: Personality 2/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What possession is most important to you?
listitem2: 2. What is your greatest achievement?
listitem3: 3. What do you always carry with you?
listitem4: 4. Who would be your perfect dinner date? Why?
listitem5: 5. If you could change one thing about the past, what would it be?

name: Personality 3/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you think it would be good to be famous? What are the positive/negative things about being famous?
listitem2: 2. When was the last time you gave someone the hand?
listitem3: 3. When was the last time you left something until the last minute?
listitem4: 4. Tell four dates, four names and four places that are important to you.
listitem5: 5. What are the strongest memories of your childhood?

name: Personality 4/4
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What was 'one of the most memorable moments' of the decade in which you grew up?
listitem2: 2. Were things 'developing and getting better' for your generation?
listitem3: 3. What part of your past do you like 'in retrospect'?
listitem4: 4. In which cases do you need to know more about the circumstances to make your decision?
listitem5: 5. In what circumstances should a judge be very lenient/harsh?

name: Education
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Who was your favourite/least favourite teacher at school? Why? Were your teachers traditional in their approach to teaching?
listitem2: 2. Do you think this was good or bad?
listitem3: 3. Is there a university in your town? What can you study there?
listitem4: 4. Where did you go to primary school?
listitem5: 5. Which subjects did you enjoy at secondary school?

name: Movies & TV 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What kinds of programmes do you enjoy watching on television?
listitem2: 2. Which television programmes are popular in your country at the moment?
listitem3: 3. What's your favourite type of film?
listitem4: 4. Do you enjoy watching comedy programmes? Why?/Why not?
listitem5: 5. Which ones are popular in your country?

name: Movies & TV 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Which comedy programmes do you enjoy watching?
listitem2: 2. Do you watch any crime detective dramas? Which ones? What do you like/dislike about them?
listitem3: 3. What are the features of good detective dramas, e.g. interesting characters?
listitem4: 4. What are the most famous quiz shows in your country? Do you like them?
listitem5: 5. What type of questions do quiz shows in your country ask (history, general knowledge, culture, etc.)?

name: Technology & Social Media 1/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you use social media?
listitem2: 2. Which ones are popular in your country? Do you use them? Why/Why not?
listitem3: 3. What kind of situations do you think people can change by using social networks?
listitem4: 4. How do you think they might do this?
listitem5: 5. How can social media help young people to organise political changes?

name: Technology & Social Media 2/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What do you think a 'web celebrity' is?
listitem2: 2. How do people become famous on the internet?
listitem3: 3. Can you think of examples of web celebrities?
listitem4: 4. Decide which gadgets are essential/not essential for you. Think about why you need them.
listitem5: 5. Why can be the internet bad for relationships?

name: Technology & Social Media 3/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. In general, do you like or dislike new technology and gadgets like ebooks, tablets and phones?
listitem2: 2. Can you think of ways in which technology has made our lives better/worse?
listitem3: 3. Are there any problems which technology has helped to solve? Give examples.
listitem4: 4. What do you think are the main advantages and disadvantages of technology in everyday life?
listitem5: 5. Which items of technology in your life make you more or less happy?

name: English language learning 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you ever have problems trying to communicate with people who can't speak your language?
listitem2: 2. Why do you think so many people give up trying to learn a foreign language?
listitem3: 3. Why are you learning English? For work, exams, travel, etc.?
listitem4: 4. Do you speak any languages apart from your mother tongue and English?
listitem5: 5. Who is the best language learner in your family?

name: English language learning 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Did you use any learning strategies when studying your second language? Which?
listitem2: 2. When was the first time you used a foreign language outside the classroom?
listitem3: 3. Do you have the chance to speak/write to native speakers regularly?
listitem4: 4. Which is more important to you when you learn to speak a language: fluency or accuracy?
listitem5: 5. Do you know anyone who is bilingual? What advantages might they have in life?

name: Feelings & Emotions 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What`s the most embarrassing/funniest/scariest thing that has ever happened to you?
listitem2: 2. What makes you angry or annoyed?
listitem3: 3. What sorts of things do you find relaxing?
listitem4: 4. Is there anything you are frightened of?
listitem5: 5. What kinds of things make you worried?

name: Feelings & Emotions 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Have you ever been really embarrassed?
listitem2: 2. What makes you feel exhausted?
listitem3: 3. What sorts of things do you find confusing?
listitem4: 4. Do you find your job/life satisfying?
listitem5: 5. Have you ever done anything you regret?

name: Family and Friends 1/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Would you like to have a brother or sister? Why?
listitem2: 2. What are the advantages of being an only child?
listitem3: 3. How close is your relationship with your sibling(s)? Are you similar to each other? In what ways?
listitem4: 4. Are you closer to one sibling than the other(s)? Which one and why?
listitem5: 5. Are you competitive with your sibling(s)? If yes, give examples.

name: Family and Friends 2/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you know your neighbours? How well do you know them?
listitem2: 2. Do you have a good relationship with them? Why?
listitem3: 3. What type of things do good neighbours do?
listitem4: 4. What type of things do bad neighbours do?
listitem5: 5. How have your friendships evolved over the years, from childhood to adulthood?

name: Family and Friends 3/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Share stories or reflections on the impact your friendships have had on your personal growth and development.
listitem2: 2. What qualities do you value most in your friends, and how have these criteria changed over time?
listitem3: 3. Discuss how your family's values, beliefs, and traditions have been passed down through generations.
listitem4: 4. Describe unique cultural traditions related to family and friendship celebrations in your culture or community.
listitem5: 5. Have you maintained long-distance friendships, and how do you stay connected despite the geographical separation?

name: Entrepreneurship and Startups
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Can you think of any companies that started small?
listitem2: 2. How many global brand cafés or restaurants can you think of?
listitem3: 3. Do you agree that luxury brands are a good thing because they give people something to aspire to or do you think they cause division and envy?
listitem4: 4. Do you think that luxury brands spend too much money on advertising and are therefore bad value for money?
listitem5: 5. Do you `treat yourself` to luxury brands or do you regard them as a waste of money?

name: Innovations of the Future 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Do you think there will be new kinds of technology in the future which will increase our happiness? What will they be?
listitem2: 2. How can artificial intelligence (AI) improve healthcare, and what are some current applications?
listitem3: 3. Can you share examples of AI-driven advancements in diagnostics, treatment, or patient care?
listitem4: 4. What ethical considerations should be taken into account when implementing AI in healthcare?
listitem5: 5. What are some innovative technologies being developed to address environmental challenges like climate change and pollution?

name: Innovations of the Future 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Can you share success stories of environmental tech solutions making a positive impact?
listitem2: 2. How can individuals and communities contribute to the adoption of environmentally friendly technologies?
listitem3: 3. What are the potential benefits of human colonization of other planets, and what challenges must be overcome?
listitem4: 4. Can you discuss recent advancements in space exploration and colonization efforts?
listitem5: 5. What ethical considerations should be taken into account when discussing space colonization?

name: Personal tastes
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. If you had to answer quiz questions on one subject, which subject would you choose?
listitem2: 2. If you had to answer questions on one famous person in history, who would you choose?
listitem3: 3. What do you like most/least about your lifestyle?
listitem4: 4. What is your favourite sound, smell and taste?
listitem5: 5. Which decade do you think was good for film and music?

name: Weather and Seasons 1/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What are your favorite activities during each season, and why do you enjoy them?
listitem2: 2. How do your favorite seasonal activities contribute to your physical and mental well-being?
listitem3: 3. Are there any specific rituals or traditions you have for each season that enhance your experience?
listitem4: 4. Do you find that your mood or energy levels vary with the changing seasons, and if so, how?
listitem5: 5. Can you share stories of memorable moments or experiences tied to seasonal activities?

name: Weather and Seasons 2/2
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How do unexpected weather events add excitement or spontaneity to your life?
listitem2: 2. How do these seasonal aesthetics influence your mood and creativity?
listitem3: 3. Do you engage in any seasonal art or crafts inspired by the beauty of nature during that time of year?
listitem4: 4. Share any personal stories or memories related to the aesthetics of different seasons.
listitem5: 5. What changes, if any, have you noticed in your local environment due to climate change, and how do they affect your community?

name: Mental Health and Well-being
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. What are some effective strategies you use for coping with stress and anxiety in your daily life?
listitem2: 2. Can you share personal stories of how stress management techniques have helped you overcome challenging situations?
listitem3: 3. How do you recognize the signs of stress or anxiety in yourself?
listitem4: 4. Are there any relaxation techniques or mindfulness practices you find particularly helpful in reducing stress?
listitem5: 5. Talk about the importance of self-care routines for maintaining good mental health. How do you define self-care?

name: Art and Creativity 1/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How do you personally use creative activities as a form of therapy or stress relief?
listitem2: 2. Can you share specific art forms or creative projects that have helped you manage your emotions or improve your mental well-being?
listitem3: 3. What is it about the process of creating art that makes it therapeutic for many people?
listitem4: 4. Are there any famous artists or art therapists whose work or methods you admire in the context of art as therapy?
listitem5: 5. How does street art contribute to discussions on social and political issues?

name: Art and Creativity 2/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. Are there any controversies or debates surrounding street art and its legality?
listitem2: 2. What role do local governments or organizations play in supporting or regulating street art?
listitem3: 3. Do you have a personal favorite art movement, and if so, why?
listitem4: 4. Share your experiences from visiting art galleries and museums. What types of art do you enjoy viewing?
listitem5: 5. Can you describe a memorable exhibit or artwork that left a lasting impression on you?

name: Art and Creativity 3/3
description: So, we have prepared a discussion topic with 5 subquestions. Participants should respond to each of the 5 questions within one round. There should be 5 rounds so that each participant can express themselves and be actively engaged.
listitem1: 1. How do art galleries and museums contribute to cultural enrichment and education?
listitem2: 2. What strategies do you use to engage with and appreciate art when visiting these institutions?
listitem3: 3. Are there any art galleries or museums you recommend to others?
listitem4: 4. Can you share examples of successful or iconic advertising campaigns that use art effectively?
listitem5: 5. How do artists and designers play a role in shaping the aesthetics and identity of brands?

name: Who am I? (Animals)
description: In this game, players take on secret identities and provide clever clues to unravel each other's personas. Uncover the mystery behind the question 'Who Am I?' as you engage in a fun-filled adventure of wit and strategy.

name: CROCODILE GAME. Animals: Different types of animals, from domestic to wild.

listitem3: Bad example: Car
